reviews.review: The best game in world

Simplemente increible... es el primer BioShock que juego y la verdad es que te engancha desde el primer momento, la musica, los paisajes que estan " vivos " mires donde mires, la historia que te hace entender a los personajes. Vale la pena comprarlo ahora toca BioShock 1 y 2 :)
10/10
Stunningly beautuiful game, which all gamers must play through at least once. EPIC!

To be honest, the gameplay itself was MEH at best.  Combat was just OK.  Not terrible, not good.

BUT THAT STORY.  I love games with story.  I played it on Hard but I'd definitely do it on Easy mode just to enjoy the story.  Wow.

Not as immersive as Rapture's world in my opinion. It's pretty though... It did seem like I had to do chores to make progress but the story is what makes it. Everything about the foundation of the first Bioshock was answered here. Great story!
The was  an entertaining game. As a bioshock fan I was not let down. Give it a 8/10

Combat may not be that amazing, but if you push forward with the story, you'll see that Bioshock Infinite provides one of the most interesting and mind boggling approaches at a storyline that I've seen thusfar.

Combat I'd give a 7/10, the combat is often tedious, I usually just rush through it for the advancement for the story.I also don't like the fact that bodies disappear too quickly, I always like to look back at the chaos I've caused, seeing a bunch of tin cans littered all over the place is quite lame.

As for the story, although it may not be as flexible as the previous games, I'll give it a 9/10 for it's plot twist. Removing a point for the fact that it is pretty linear, but the plot twist is quite unique an interesting.
Great game
Best Clucking game ever!!

BioShock Infinite is one of my favorite games of all time, for many reasons which I shall list:

1. Gorgeous music and graphics, with immersive turn-of-the-century (and later) tracks in the background, and stunning visuals that run super smooth even on my medium-power laptop. Sure the blood looks a bit like cranberry juice, but it looks good while doing so.

2. Wonderful shooting mechanics, which make you choose which weapons to use, while also giving a diverse armory with plenty of upgrades to choose from.

3. Vigors, Columbia's version of plasmids, are very diverse and well balanced, and it's really nice being able to access all of them once unlocked, which is something the previous games kinda lacked.

4. Diverse level designs, with the skylines adding an additional dimension to the field. A good mix of open areas and closed, cover-providing rooms.

5. Deep, thought-provoking storyline, that is fairly straightforward up until the time travel and dimension hopping appears. Then it gets confusing, but still quite good!

6. Elizabeth is my vote for the greatest NPC in any game I have ever played, and her loot providing and tear opening skills, along with her book smarts and shard wit, kinda make me sad she isn't real :P

I'm sure there's more, but since the only real con is a slightly fuzzy ending (and that it ends), I have to award this maybe a 10.1/10, because everyone who likes first-person shooters with at least a bit of depth should definitely play this game!

I wouldn't recommend this game @ $60 but it would be really hard to find it at that price.  I purchased this game well in advance of the launch as I loved Bioshock 1 and 2 along w/ the DLC.  The game promised a lot and while it did deliver a lot you could see glimpses of the promises that were made in the final product, so shame on me for buying into the hype.  

BioShock Infiinte is a FPS like the prior 2 games (mentioned above), the gunplay wasn't my favorite (felt a little sloppy), the powers and the traversal were great though.  I enjoyed the story and really liked the ending.  If you liked the previous games or just like FPS games in general I think you'll enjoy this.  Haven't made it around to play the DLC yet but I've heard very good things about it as well.
Repetetive combat but a rich story and compelling characters.

Infinite is a state-of-the-art computer game. If you play video games, then you need to play this game. This is my review and the rest is detail.

I have to admit that I have played better games before, not great in numbers but yet I have played. Therefore I don't think the Infinite is the best game ever. I even don't know whether I liked Bioshock 1 or Infinite more. But I can say Infinite is the best shooter I have played in years and one of the best games.

Irrational Games was a very talented studio and their experience from the first two Bioshock games shines on this game. The concept is exceptional, probably more wilder than Rapture. The writing is terrific. Graphics are very good and the game optimization is incredible. From trailers to in-game, the music is very very good. Event the sound effects are top-notch.  

So the flaws. As mentioned a thousand times, combat is not solid enough compared to the other aspects of the game. Gameplay is somekind of repetitive, though I can say it seldom looses it's excitement. Gameplay time of the main game may be a little longer, maybe a few hours more. I completed it in 16 hours in the hard mode.

From the depths of the ocean to the skies. I like the concept that Irrational Games were telling. I like their creative style and imagination. This game has much of them. It is a shame that we may never play a new Bioshock, and even if we play it won't be the same.

9.5

Would be wonderful if the gameplay wasn't the most fucking boring, generic garbage. Should have kept the bioshock 1 style gameplay maybe fused with skyrims. I don't know but the story and DLC story was amazing. 

8.5/10

My compulsive-hoboing stopped only when there was nothing left to raid.

Sure, I could be examining the floating buildings, trying to figure out what keeps them in the sky, examining the artwork throughout the city, learning lore about Comstock, or trying to get to know the people who call this crazy place home. But no, there’s silver in those there trashcans and nobody’s stopping me from claiming it as my own!

6/10

Read more: http://www.substance-tv.com/biochock-infinite-review-infinite-form-finite-function/
It´s probobly one of the best single player game i ever have played :-)
Historia sobervia y jugabilidad más que entretenida. De los juegos que generan recuerdos. Memorable.
Infinitely worth your time.
Très bon scénario ainssi qu'une jouabilité digne de bioshock premier du nom je recommande
Yes!

In the deep sea of Alantas, they say Rapture will never float. In the high sky's of heaven, they say Columbia will never fall.

What I loved:

 1. The characters, to be spacific, Elisabeth is an amazing exxcort. From being helpful to picking locks. This girl can do it all. I didn't feel much for the main character as in pervious bioshock games. You wake up not knowing who you are or can remember vage detials about why your there but that's it.

2. Columbia City, The fist view of the city, it's beach, carnival, and life like design. I'm convinced that if a city in the sky were to exists. It would be called Columbia and it would be hevean it'self. The city was so beautiful, I shed tires. Pure Graphic delight. 

3. Give it some time in, it's fun! I had a lot of fun, from combat to upgrades, to rips in time, to air ship battles and even time travel!? What? It's a joy cause rips the game and this game is actually scarry at points. It's not a bad thing. It's welcome. Nice C sharp at the right times. 


What i didn't like:

1. No maps. I wanna go back to that one vault lock i couldn't open. Sure, I know where it is, 30 minutes later, Ahhh fudge it.

2. Bad combat choices. Why the hell do i only have two guns? Why don't the vender's sell ammo or upgrades for the minigun? Why do I only have two vigor options on pc? No one gun has the same bullet size. Why aren't there any grandes or traps like a mine? No knife, why can't i pick one up? 

3. Loading screens. It's not a big one as most loading screens have loaded under 30 secs but i felt that if they weren't there. The game could have been a lot better.



This game is a roller coaster ride, all the things i didn't like are minor and close to nothing in the game This is a Grade A title. 5 stars, A must own in my book.
I highly recommend this game. It has a great story, a cool environment, and challenging fights. Be sure to look for the recordings for some back story to help explain what is going on.

Time Travel, Parallel Universes, A quest for redemption, and a man with a brand. This game immerses you and the story and you relate to the characters, even the main villain in the end is relatable. This story is so heart wrenching and emotional, you have not lived til you've played it.
Visually stunning game with a awesome world to travel in, the storyline is so DEEP. One of the best games in our generation
I wish it would never end

One of the best story in videogaming ever. This should be played and reflected upon vy everyone who loves good scriptwriting. The gameplay is really the worst thing about the game. I just feel that for a game that aims and achieves so greatly with its fantastic journey, shooting at bad guys and throwing plasmids... Just feels off. And frustrating on hard difficulty. You'l be dying so much you'l never have money for anything. Or it could be me that just sucks. Anyway, please play this with the Burial In Sea episodes. The story is not complete without it.

 This may be the greatest videogame story i have ever played. 

Thank you Irrational Games.
a good game to be sure
6.8/10 great story! but there are soo many missions with the same map.

after playing the game for over 24hrs i can say with being 100% positive that this is a must have game. great story great game play fantastic graphics. 2K hit it out of the park with this one. the on question get asked a lot is do you need to play the first 2 before getting this one? and the answer i give is no you do not. infinite has to in common with the first 2 except the game play style. the story is totallty different then the first 2 and doesnt mention them at all. i rate this one a solid 10/10

"Бесконечный" - слово, которым пронизана вся игра, является как бы подсказкой, на которую вряд ли кто-то обратил внимания, дается нам в самом начале игры. И стоит отметить, что это относится не только к сюжету - игра действительно "бесконечная",  даже в том смысле, что после прохождения, желание еще раз "прожить" эту историю повторяется! Повторяются и эпитеты, которые можно восклицать "бесконечное" количество раз!!!

И действительно, "бесконечно" прекрасно здесь все - графика, геймплей, история, малышка Элизабет ... все!!!
Честно говоря, графике игры  можно посвятить отдельную поэму, потому что такую красоту, я  видела только в "Скайриме"! Все прорисовано настолько детально и настолько красиво, что с первых минут игры кажется, что ты действительно попал в рай!

Говоря о сюжете, то здесь хочу снять шляпу, а заодно и все что на мне надето, перед 2K! Ну правда, такой невероятно запутанный "клубок событий", в конце превращается в элегантный "свитер", в нечто настолько неожиданное и непонятное, что я не сразу поняла, что это конец, что история закончилась! Так же здорово, что до самого конца, нет каких-то прямых подсказок, как например в предыдущих частях, где либо ты добряк, либо ты злодей! [b] Здесь ты просто парень с надеждой в сердце и пушкой в руке! [/b]

А вообще, не смотря на мою природную склонность все преувеличивать и излишнюю впечатлительность, как вы уже поняли, [b] Bioshock Infinite [/b] - это действительно, одна из лучших игр в которую я когда либо играла!!! И как говорил старина Клинт Истувуд существует два типа людей: одни будут восхищаться этой игрой еще не один месяц,
а другие опять ничего не поняли...
Five star story, I hope I will see it as a movie some day.

Two weapon holding limit, linear levels with little to no exploration, uninspired tonics that have no reason for existing (pop-up hints even refered to them as plasmids) and to top it all off a shit story that is so far up its own arse it can't see how pretentious it is. This game was an attempt to get the COD gamer to like Bioshock, I hope that 2k is happy with that audience because they have drove away real fans of the series.
Literally the best game I've ever played. I come back to it at least once a year, at least. Sometimes more.
By the end of the game I wanted to drown myself. 10/10

All i can say is that, to this day the story line in BSI is the best and most immersive. holy god i love this story. brilliant FPS game as well, great game play and well written charecters. if you have not played this game, i envy you as i would love to get the feeling of completing this game all over again for the first time. LOVE THIS GAME!

P.S i completed this on console not PC so i have not completed it in 4 hours as my play time suggests
Might be one of the best games I've ever played. Recommended!

Кинцо нормальное,шутер плохой. Элизабет сначала очень радует,но потом и она приедается.  
От игры так и веет консольщиной - убогая графика, укрытия, нет карты, куча одинакового оружия,головы врагов лопаются от выстрелов. И это когда то было игрой года....

Bioshock Infinite follows in the footsteps of the original Bioshock by pairing mediocre game mechanics with a gripping story.

Essentially a corridor shooter, the gameplay mechanics can be summed up as linearly moving from room to room, mowing down a small army, upgrading/healing at vending machines, then repeating.  The plasmids or "vigors" as they are now known add some variation, but for the most part there is nothing revolutionary here.  Still, the shooting is competently executed, if not actually remarkable in any way.

One thing that does stick out is that the player is limited to two weapons at a time.  Since weapons also need to be upgraded to stay useful as the difficulty ramps, this limitation encourages players to horde their favorite upgraded weapons rather than throwing one away to try something new.  Ultimately it discourages experimentation and contributes to the repetitive feeling of combat.

Despite the gameplay flaws, I found the story to be engaging and sufficient to carry me through the game.  Just like the original Bioshock, there is plenty of spectacle and surprise in store as you wander through the bizzaro world that is Columbia.  If you are a fan of narrative-driven games (and are the type of player that will seek out the optional voxophones to get the full story), then I can recommend Bioshock Infinite.
very atmospheric but combat starts getting repetitve.

I'm not even going to describe every little detail of this game. It's just pure epicness! The game is fun and challenging to play, but the story is ...it's just amazing. If you liked the story in Bioshock, but disliked the kind of..disconnected story of Bioshock 2, then Infinite will take you back to that same magic as Bioshock 1. Needless to say, if you are a fan of a good story and a great game (as in...mechanics, challlenges, things to do), then buy this game. If there is a collection of all three Bioshocks...buy the collection!
Love it so much <3

A game in which from jumping and flying sun dizzy and about graphics and effects and say it is not necessary) in this game everything is perfect) thumbs up
It is said that the game has moved away from the horror genre. For many, it will be nice for other less pleasant discovery! The game is a direct continuation and completion of the previous parts.
The plot unfolds in the sky hovering in Columbia. The city gradually falls, and will soon collapse. Also tied to the story of a young girl Elizabeth who has a very interesting abilities.
The graphics in the game order is higher than in the previous parts but in general essentially similar to what we saw earlier.
The game takes you in the fast passage about 7 hours! But believe me this is enough))))
Logo Games is torn likeness of the American flag with the word Infinity
Well, I think a lot of highly appreciate this game, someone because he is a pervert and will wait for sex scene of the protagonist and Elizabeth, and some because they imbued this game and felt all its depth and interesting dynamic plot!
Game 9/10


Игра, в которой от прыжков и полетов вскружиться голова а о графике и эффектах и говорить не надо ) в этой игре все идеально ) палец вверх 
Стоит сказать что игра отошла от жанра ужасы. Для многих это будет приятный для других менее приятное открытие! Игра являться прямым продолжением и завершением предыдущих частей. 
Сюжет разворачивается в парящем в небе городе Колумбия. Город потихоньку падает  и скоро рухнет. Также сюжет завязан на молодой девушке Элизабет у которой есть очень интересные способности. 
Графика в игре порядком выше чем в предыдущих частях но в общей сути похожа на то что мы видели ранее. 
Игра займет у вас при быстром прохождении около 7 часов! Но поверьте этого достаточно)))) 
Логотипом игры является разорванное подобие Американского флага со словом Бесконечность 
Ну я думаю многие оценят эту игру высоко, кто-то потому что он извращенец и будет ждать сексуальную сцену главного героя и Элизабет, а кто-то потому что проникся этой игрой и ощутил всю ее глубину и интересный динамичный сюжет! 
Игра 9/10

Good game, I loved everything about it, even the ending which is a bit confusing. The setting is truly amazing, really felt like I was somewhere else. Shooting is also very nicely done, can't say a bad thing about it.

Acredito que dá pra dizer que Bioshock Infinite é o estado da arte dos FPS, em todos os aspectos. Ambientação fantástica, com gráficos maravilhosos, parte técnica impecável. Jogando no 1999 Mode a dificuldade é perfeita, com alguns inimigos bem xaropes, partes realmente desafiadoras. A duração é longa, o que eu acho ótimo, pois a história é complexa, polêmica, intrincada e bem encaixada, tornando-se atrativa durante todo o jogo. Creio que esse não tenho do que reclamar.

NOTA: 10/10
"BOOKER CATCH"

Неоднозначное мнение у меня сложилось насчет данного продукта. 

+ Атмосферный сюжет

- Местами сюжет начинает нудить
- Навигация так себе

Excellently made, great story, engaging gameplay.
Solid shooter with an amazing story!

Brilliant game, it's hardly a game it's more of an experiance, however it has great graphics and storyline it can get repetitive and has a dull ending that was highly unanticipated. I defiantly prefered the first one and maybe even the second. Its worth 15$ though, Just for the experiance.
The new sky ambiance is as amazing as the previous Rapture, and the story still deep. Bioshock is one of the best game of all the time.

Desde que comienzas a jugar tienes la sensacion de estar en una obra de arte. Para los que esteis familiarizados con la saga  puede que echeis de menos Rapture pero os pedo asegurar que Columbia es un lugar increible: ambiente, diseño, fauna... Si a esto sumamos una historia increible tenemos Bioshock Infinite.
En cuanto a jugabilidad hereda como era de esperar los controles del anterior: los vigorizadores susttuyen en esta edicion a los plasmidos tan queridos en la saga pero dejan el liston a buen nivel. Podria enumerar muchos mas detalles que hacen de este un gran juego pero restaria elementos a la sorpresa que os vais a llevar.
Como unica pega solo puedo remarcar que se trata del ultimo juego de la saga por motivos externos a ella, aunque hayan inluido DLC a modo de despedida de la compañia.
Es una compra recomendada al 101%

Recomendo jogar o BioShock 1 e 2 também. Jogo bom demais, historia muito boa. As missões extras onde em cada fase você tem que cumprir uma certa exigência são bem difíceis, só faltou uma conquista pra mim que é justamente cumprir essas exigências.
j'adore!
Dis game is gud
CLASSIC!!!

A futher decline in the quality of the series in terms of plot and atmosphere.  I found the graphics and general quality a bit lacking and it had so many bugs I just got bored.  One of the most over  hyped games of the last few years.  This might have been great if you only have console games to choose from but there have been better ports.  

Bioshock was one of my favourtie games of this type.  BI lacks the atmosphere and charm of the original completely.

Obra maestra.
Si te gusta la saga de Bioshock no te lo puedes perder y con las DLC de Burial at sea (Panteon marino en español) que te revela el origen de Rapure.
Tiene una historia buenisima, de lo mejor que he jugado.
Como en los anteriores es un shooter, usa diversidad de armas y lo que le hace diferente que tienes poderes gracias a la gran variedad de plasmidos, tambien puedes mejorar las armas y las magias
Se hechan de menos a las little sisters pero en esta ocasion te sigue Elizabeth no te contare nada de ella es mejor que lo descubras tu.
Puedes tomar decisiones en el juego que te llevaran por un final o por otro.

Puntuacion:
  10/10

OBRA MAESTRA
RECOMENDADO!!!

Para ver mas recomendaciones podeis seguirme através de este grupo http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Dungeoneros#curation
Great story, gameplay and graphics. Totally recommended, you have to play this game!

Ich finde es per se gut, wenn Spiele auch philosophische Fragen behandlen und dabei eine Welt aufbauen, die glaubwürdig ist. Dabei gilt es jedoch zwei Sachen zu bedenken. Die Story sollte zugänglich sein. Die Vorgängerspiele dominieren hier sehr und auch die amerikanische Geschichte. Das verleidet Vieles, denn dieses Wissen wird gebraucht um das Suggestive am Spiel zu verstehen. Der zweite Punkt ist, dass man über die Welt und die Story das Spiel nicht vergessen sollte. Die Steuerung ist sehr fummelig und die Shootereinlagen manches Mal einfach nur Glück oder Pech vom Überleben her. Außerdem wird sehr exzessiv auf Arenen gebaut. Das heißt man wandelt durch die Welt und entdeckt Storyteile.. man sieht dann aber schon am Aufbau, wenn man gleich wieder rumballern muss. Es gibt keine Überraschungen.
A good shooter with fun mechanics and a good story line. Something truely rare in FPS games.

Absolutely beautiful game.
Controls are smooth and intuitive, especially if you have a game controller.
Graphics are stunning and the world is beautifully crafted.
Music and audio are remarkably engineered and really enhances the game play.
Story is entrancing, you just want more.
You have to play this game. Get it, whether its on sale or not. You just have to play this game.

"There's always a lighthouse, there's always a man, there's always a city."

There's always an excellent story.

Bioshock infinite è un videogioco sviluppato da Irrational Games pubblicato a febbraio 2013 da 2K Games sulle piattaforme Windows, PS3 e Xbox 360 e dal 29 agosto 2013 su MAC. Il gioco appartiene al genere dei First Person Shooter, italianizzato in Sparatutto in prima persona, ed è completamente slegato ai due precedenti Bioshock se non per alcuni riferimenti minori. L'ambientazione è di tipo steampunk e buona parte della trama è ispirata alla teoria dei “multiuniversi” e al fenomeno del “Butterfly Effect”.

Immagine

La trama di base è abbastanza semplice: il protagonista, Booker DeWitt, per pagare alcuni debiti di gioco viene assunto a forza per salvare una ragazza, di nome Elizabeth, tenuta prigioniera nella città volante di Columbia.
Da qui il giocatore si vedrà proiettato in aria da un razzo partito dal faro in cui è stato accompagnato nella fantastica città volante di Columbia, di forte ispirazione suddista. Il giocatore, dopo un battesimo religioso, potrà entrare in città e farsi sommergere dalla vita della città, in un ambiente decisamente vivo ambientato in una festa cittadina: qui il giocatore potrà fare pratica con il tiro a segno, scoprire la nuova forma dei Plasmoidi, ottenendo il primo, e cominciare ad ambientarsi nella città fino a quando, durante una lotteria a cui viene costretto a partecipare dagli avvenimenti, la popolazione nota la sua cicatrice a forma di “AD” sul dorso della mano destra questo, come il giocatore ha potuto scoprire prima da un poster, lo identifica come nemico della popolazione, con il nome di “falso profeta”, e di conseguenza due poliziotti tenteranno di arrestarlo.
Ovviamente il nostro protagonista non si farà arrestare ed eliminerà i due poliziotti con una scena da far invidia a Pulp Fiction, ottenendo quindi la pistola di un poliziotto e uno strumento per utilizzare le immense zipline – definite nel gioco SkyLine – di Columbia. Il protagonista si farà quindi strada verso il monumento in cui è tenuta prigioniera Elizabeth, liberandola in una rocambolesca fuga aerea.

Immagine

Andando avanti nella trama si scoprirà che Elizabeth è dotata di straordinari poteri: ella è infatti in grado di aprire dei varchi verso nuove dimensioni che possono differire per tempo o per alcuni dettagli, come avvenimenti svolti in maniera differente o personaggi con approcci differenti verso il nostro protagonista. La trama scorre abbastanza leggera e classica fino alle battute finali, in cui la trama acquisisce un profondo pathos. Evito ulteriori spoiler per non rovinare la trama – uno dei componenti meglio riuscito di questo gioco – a chi deve giocarlo ma concludo definendo la trama di questo gioco una delle migliori mai viste in questa generazione.

Immagine

Il gameplay è piuttosto classico parlando di un fps, salvo per la disposizione poco felice dei tasti di default nella versione PC: quanto è scomodo mirare con il collimatore metallico premendo Z?
Potremmo portare con noi fino a due armi per volta ma munizioni per tutte le armi e, nel caso fossimo a secco di munizioni, vi sono sparsi per la mappa dei negozi che vendendo le munizioni di ogni arma da noi scoperta.

Immagine

Il gioco ha una impronta assai action e frenetica, saranno pochi i momenti in cui non verremo circondati da nemici, con continui combattimenti da diverse altezze, perché la città di Columbia è formata da chiatte volanti a differenti altezze ed anche i nemici sanno usare le SkyLine.
Componente abbastanza inusuale del combattimento è Elizabeth, che non starà ferma al riparo a farsi proteggere dal “cavaliere di turno” ma continuerà a cercare rifornimenti per noi, passandoci armi cariche quando finiremo i colpi, dandoci dei medicamenti nel caso fossimo feriti o sali nel caso non avessimo abbastanza potere per usare i Vigor. Tali aiuti non avverranno sempre ma casualmente, ergo non verremo sempre salvati da morte certa da un medkit lanciato dalla fanciulla ne potremo permetterci di sparare alla rambo con la certezza di essere costantemente riforniti di colpi: quello che è certo è che Elizabeth ci dia risorse in base alla sua effettiva presenza nella mappa: se per terra ci sono armi cadute a terra dei nemici ci passerà prevalentemente quelle, anche se nelle difficoltà più basse gli interventi miracolosi, ovvero il passaggio di risorse non presenti quali medkit in una mappa oramai vuota, sono molto più frequenti.

L'intelligenza artificiale è assai stupida per la media dei giochi attuali anche se ha quel minimo di intelletto per mettersi al riparo e non prendere proiettili su proiettili.

Immagine

Le armi a disposizione del nostro protagonista spaziano dalla pistola, una replica di una Mauser di inizio secolo, a mitragliatrici cloni di uno Sten e armi Gatheling a manovella, oltre che a lanciagranate a tamburo, carabine (copie dell'M1 Garant) e molte altre. Tutte le armi possono acquisire quattro potenziamenti da un particolare negozio e saranno abbastanza costosi, tali potenziamenti non introducono nuove modalità di fuoco ma si limitano a migliorare le caratteristiche delle armi, come maggiore capienza, maggiore danno o velocità di fuoco o ricarica.
Nel combattimento hanno un grande peso anche i Vigor, nuova forma dei Plasmoidi -particolari poteri "magici", marchio di fabbrica di Bioshock - dei precedenti capitoli, utilizzati sia dal protagonista che dai nemici, se pur in diverse forme. I plasmoidi consumano una loro barra energetica chiamata Sali e hanno diversi effetti, dalla granata incendiaria al bloccare i proiettili in arrivo fino a lanciare uno stormo di corvi assassini contro i nostri nemici. Sinceramente non mi sono sembrati tutti particolarmente utili: se pur interessanti molti sono semplicemente poco efficaci o poco pratici, anche se alcuni hanno anche un effetto ambientale: infiammare un nemico sopra una perdita di petrolio o fulminarlo sopra una pozza d'acqua infatti infliggerà maggior danno. Anche i Vigor sono potenziabili ad un apposito negozio.

Immagine

I nemici variano dal semplice soldato ad una specie di uomo-macchina definito come “Handyman”, anche definito “il BigDaddy di Bioshock Infinite”, comprendendo anche soldati capaci di usare singoli Vigor, utilizzandoli in maniera impossibile per il protagonista, o soldati completamente meccanici.

Immagine

Le ambientazioni sono molto aperte e colorate, la gamma del gioco è sui colori pastello, e complice il grande uso delle SkyLine si ha sempre una grande visuale della città fluttante. Il tema delle ambientazioni è steam-punkeggiante, mostrando una città ideale suddista con una tecnologia impossibile per quell'epoca, con tanto di chiatta-spiaggia per le vacanze, abbinate ad alcune zone degradate come una fabbrica di fine 800, con turni massacranti e assoluto disprezzo per i diritti dei lavoratori, e zone povere e devastate. Le ambientazioni sono tutt'altro che “morte”: quando non si è in combattimento si possono sentire vivi dialoghi fra gli abitanti di Columbia e vederli vivere nella loro città in maniera abbastanza realistica, anche se aspettando troppo si nota una marcata ripetizione nei loro dialoghi. Le mappe dei vari capitoli non sono un corridoio scriptato, permettendo spesso delle deviazioni, anche di pochi passi, e diverse missioni secondarie, è infatti utilizzato un arteficio molto old-school: spesso la mappa del capitolo è una sola mappa, dalle dimensioni abbastanza grandi, e i vari step del capitolo non faranno altro che spedirci in lungo e largo di tale mappa.

Immagine
[...]
Per motivi di spazio la recensione continua qui: http://videogamezone.eu/index.php?mode=recensioni&post=3352

It is a point A to point B over rated game. The story is not that intriguing, the characters are a bunch of try hards to be interesting. The graphics are flat and dull and is just washed out with post processing effects (which make the layman herpaderps go WOW GREAT GRAPHICS). 

Glad I bought this $5. Go play The Last of Us, it is a far cry from this lamer.

+Engaging story
+Amazing visuals
+Story DLC is worthwhile
-Poor gameplay execution

I did not enjoy this game. I found the gameplay to grindy, the bosses to limited in variation and basically all they had was a enormous amount of health. The guns were forgettable, but the setting was both beautiful and interesting. I found the alternate history really interesting and the museum section was particularly interesting. The story took me a few goes to grasp but I persevered and found an extremely intracite plot involving lost personalities etc. There was very little challenge from combinations of various different enemy attacks bar finding sufficient ammo supplies to last the game without "Booker, catch". The skylines were a pretty fun and unique addition to the game.

The clash in the clouds DLC was just more of exactly what I hated, but a 2K game by law has to be a DLC fest.

Return to Rapture (I don't remember the proper name) was also interesting, but somewhat convoluted, but less so than the main game.

All in all, I know a hell of a lot of people enjoyed this game, but I did not, for the reasons listed above.

I normally am not a fan of first-person shooters, but I make an exception for games with amazing stories. This one qualifies in spades. As a bonus, you don't even need to have played the prior games in the series (though there is a part where that will help you appreciate the story better).
nota 10  história foda pra caralho,  gráficos lindos e a jogabilidade ótima um dos melhores fps que já joguei senão o melhor
Excellent story and very competant gunplay.

Soy una persona enamorada de BISOHOCK y de Rapture, pero he de decir que BIOSHOCK INFINITE ha conseguido hacer que un juego (solo un maldito juego) me haga tener sensaciones increibles. Ya han pasado 6 años desde el primero de la saga. Esta vez tenemos de nuevo a Ken Levin en el equipo de desarrollo y eso siempre es bueno. Este juego es sencillamente una jodida y absoluta obra maestra.

El personaje de Elizabeth es increiblemente perfecto. Sus dialogos, sus expresiones y sus formas de reaccionar ante lo que vaya sucediendo van a hacer que poco a poco acabes quieriendo casarte con esta mujer. Podremos oir pequeñas criticas que todos pensamos y nunca decimos de la sociedad. Pequeñas bromas. Son esos pequeños detalles los que marcan la diferencia.

La banda sonora en este caso es magnifica. Es maravilloso ver como una canción puede influir tanto en tu experiencia de juego. Recomiendo escuchar todas y cada una de las canciones detenidamente para poder sentir cada escena del juego.

En este caso la historia de BIOSHOCK INFINITE se supera a si misma. Juntando al experiencia de este juego junto a sus DLCs la trama que queda es digna de ser llevada a la gran pantalla. No voy a hacer spoiler de ningún tipo, pero solo diré una cosa, todo tendrá sentido al final de la saga.

La nueva ciudad que visitaremos es realmente hermosa. Rapture ya lo era, pero Columbia... no tiene palabras. Yo siempre diré que Rapture es mejor, pero esta no se queda lejos. Cada edificio esta pensado, cada rayo de luz y cada personaje que te vas topando por la calle. Una autética maravilla.

Puntos positivos:

-Por fin se puede correr (si joder, si).
-Poder hacer combinaciones de vigorizantes (plásmidos) da una nueva forma de combate.
-La variedad de personajes aumenta y ya no nos toparemos más veces con el mismo "extra" cada dos por tres.
-Los pequeños guiños a las antiguas entregas de la saga da un nuevo punto a esta historia.
-La variedad de armas es enorme y es de agradecer.
-La capacidad de llevar todos los vigorizantes encima sin preocuparse de comprar ranuras se agradece.
-La dificulta "dificil" y "modo 1999" resultan un verdadero reto.

Puntos negativos:

-El poder llevar solo dos armas encima limita bastante el juego y el combate.
-Un poco más lineal que las anteriores entregas.

En resumen: debéis encerraros en casa y jugar a esta obra de arte. Sencillamente se merece un 11/10.
This is the best game ever.

Un des meilleurs jeux solo que j'ai pu faire. C'est rare dans un FPS-Aventure d'avoir une histoire aussi interessante et prenante que celle-ci. Un jeu marquant, impressionnant et bluffant dans beaucoup de domaine, un jeu a AVOIR sans hesitez ! (Au meme titre que Bioshock 1)

Вердикт:
Зайдя в игру, я задался вопросам, может ли Infinite носить имя BioShock отбросив свой мир "Восторга", большого Папу и сестричек, воюющюю философию, и начать с нуля. Когда я вышел из игры то понял что нет. В общей сложности, BioShock Infinite является блестящим шутером, который подталкивает весь жанр вперед с инновациями в обоих повествованиях и геймплее. Она проигрывает в паре мест Bioshock, но ни в коем случае не должна уходить на покой, она должна быть в наших объятиях с большим энтузиазмом.

+ Богатая, удовлетворяющая история
+ Сочное направление искусства
+ Бесчисленные боевые возможности
+ Элизабет имеет значение для обоих историй и геймплея

- Ощущается не много не законченной игрой
- Тяжела к восприятию
- В местах однообразна

Оценка
Субъективно (Я не фанат биошока, а как полноценная игра это такой себе рельсовый шутер) - 7/10
Объективно - 9.5/10
La forma en la que te enfrentas a tus enemigos es impresinante, y siempre en ese escenario steampunk, alegoría a los años 50's, genial.

Игра оставляет смешанные чувства после прохождения, с одной стороны - стороны геймплея - это обычный шутер, похожий на предыдущие части, а с другой стороны - это шедевр, такой интересной истории и замысловатого сюжета не было уже давно. Пройдя игру, не сразу осознаешь, что она закончилась, остается много недосказанного, что будет, кстати, "досказано" в DLC, но не в этом суть. 
Хочу сказать, что Кен Левин просто превзошел себя, концовка оставляет о себе знать, даже после второго происхождения я некоторое время размышлял о том, что произошло. Прекрасная игра, что же ещё сказать.

Проект полностью оправдывать свою оценку на metacritic, 94/100. Не меньше.

Best singleplayer game I've ever played. 10/10 story, 10/10 graphics!
One of the best games ever made, totally worth ever penny!

Columbia Paradiso. 

Si Rapture se convirtió en aquel lugar distópico de antigua gloria y esplendor, capaz de ocultar las historias más oscuras y perversas, Columbia nos enseña el color de  la utopía, la cúspide del progreso humano, capaz de conquistar las nubes, los cielos y todo ese paraíso flotante que es Columbia. Al menos en la apariencia claro. Esta saga es archiconocida por lo que oculta tras la apariencia y en este caso Bioshock Infinite luce con sus mejores galas, con un despliegue técnico y audiovisual exquisitos, que se pueden gozar hasta en el rincón más recóndito de la ciudad. Sin embargo, cuanto más fuerte es la luz, más oscuras son las sombras que proyecta y en este sentido la historia responde a ese fenómeno lumínico a la perfección, con claroscuros, ni buenos ni malos, tan solo personas movidas irremediablemente por el transcurso de los acontecimientos. 
Un acierto en esta entrega es la inclusión de la voz del protagonista. Si en la primera apenas conectábamos con Jack, en Infinite Booker Dewitt es el que aporta el carisma necesario para identificarnos y creernos la historia. Queremos saber quién es y qué rol cumple la trama, su evolución es vital. 

Definitivamente se trata de un juego fantástico, tanto por lo que muestra como por lo que hay que descubrir. No sé si es el mejor al que puedes jugar, pero probablemente sea uno de los mejores a los que podrás. Nota 9/10

One of the best games i have ever played. 
Bioshok1 had a pretty good story but not the best gameplay even thou there were a lot of good ideas. In Bioshok2 they managed to solve this problems and made a really awesome game. It's crazy how they even made a better game with Bioshok Infinite. 

If you loved the Bioshok storyline so far i highly recomend to play the "Burial at sea"-DLC's, you will love the ending if you played the whole thing.

Bueno, considero la saga de Bioshock una de las mejores de esta generación. Pero sin duda la mejor es Bioshock Infinite, su trama su modo de juego todo encaja perfectamente. La forma en la que el juego juega con la mente del jugador para llevarlo por donde quiere y tenerlo atrapado hasta el ultimo momento, eso tambien permite que no se desmenuce la historia antes de tiempo ya que nunca podrias llegar a  imaginar el final del juego.

Los graficos son geniales para lo que es el juego la imagenes son muy pulcras todo esta en armonia y encima la musica hace que te el juego te absorba y te introduzca en esa epoca, la verdad tiene una banda sonora inmejorable.

Otra cosa que recomiendo son los DLC's sobre todo los de "Burial at the sea" hacen que la trama del juego mejore increiblemente y tu cerebro explote de toda la informacion que te dan.

Este juego es una simple obra maestra es el punto culminante de toda la saga y es un juego al que todo el mundo deberia juegar eso si, siempre antes habiendo jugado a los dos anteriores.

Très décevant. Non seulement le scenar est moins bon que les deux jeux precedents, mais en plus les phases de combat sont chiantes comme la mort, à cause d'un level design très quelconque et d'un rythme trop monotone.

This game is some serious next level shit. Even if you haven't played the other 2 games this really stands out on its own, though the DLC has a lot more throwback. It has elements of stealth, action, platforming, and puzzle games and its all seemlessly put together with an absolutely terrifying roller coaster thrill ride of a plot.

So, I sat down and did one run through of this game, and it was absolutely gorgeous. From the way the textures felt to the way the enemies died, this is how videogames should look. The powers felt very welll crafted as well, and the storyline, absolutely phenomenal. I found myself almost passing up items in pursuit of Elisabeth when she was in trouble. The moments when she was in trouble ansolutely terrified me. It does such a splendid job making you care for Elisabeth and Dewitt, I think it takes a bit of counscous effort to remember that you aren't in fact DeWitt. However, that brings me to the reason why I cannot reccommend this game.
As DeWitt, you have atyour disposal an array of guns and powers to use as you please, when you please. However, it felt very heavily leaned towards gun use. Smaller enemies I would simply shoot once in the head, and the large enemies were easily disposed of with shock jockey spamming. It was...boring combat. The only reason I wanted to get through it, or had any interest was to continue the story. The battles themselves were very repetitive and left something to be desired from these well crafted powers given to the player. There was too much emphasis on the battles, as you spend probably 75% of the game fighting, for it to come off as average, if that. And it was anything but strategic, I never took cover in that game, i ran in, guns a blazing and died a whopping once. Granted, it was medium difficulty.
This game was beautiful, held my attention with the story, but the combat was simply not all there.

Bioshock Infinite was definitly an amazing game. Would I recomend it? Heck yeah!  The gameplay and story line was awesome. There is plenty of game time to keep you busy. Action starts quick in the story.  And for performance on my pc? No problems! Amazing graphics, no freezing or crashes. Definitly worth the money.
I absolutely loved this game. The second bioshock lacked the crazy twist at the end but they redeemed themselves in this.

this game is just amazing with amazing gamplay and a very good story i rate it 9.5/10

As you have probably seen Bioshock: Infinite looks like anything but beloved Rapture, with bright pastel colors, happy people and joyful music. But the more you play the more dreadful similarities will come up. This is legitimate Bioshock believe me...

The rest is just pure artistic bonanza form Ken Levine. But this time the city is stated where it should be- as a background. Rapture was just too compelling and was just stealing the show. Here main characters can finally shine and the hell they are. You will happily stand by harsh Booker DeWitt, adore Elizabeth and look up to the Lutece twins. The story mess up their lives and will change their way of thinking the way you will not easily guess. Plot will enchant you and will refuse to leave your brain after the ending. You will live with it for a long time.

As far as gameplay goes it is not rocket science and besides skylines there is nothing much more than an old school shooter- which is great for me. Harder difficulties will also force you to learn a proper usage of your plasmids/vigors so you will have to adapt to the situation and develop proper tactics including gunfire and combined vigors multiplying its effects. You will also have no room for additional health kits and ammo- this is where Elizabeth takes a major role in your gameplay. She serves as you timed inventory throwing you what you need meanwhile staying clear out of your iron sights. She literally behaves better than 90% of people you will find in co-op games.

Another thing to mention is godlike voice acting and greatly written and re-written music. If the story was not that great the audio would be definitely the prime part of the game. Moreover in DLCs you can still visit Rapture. How great is that?

It is the best written FPS game in the last years, If you enjoy complex story and memorable characters but strife form RPGs- this is your thing.
I think I want my life back.
